author: funnygiulio
content: I just noticed something: is  the transaction root in ExecutionPayloadHeader an ssz hash or rlp hash?

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> It's rlp, but we're consider changing it to ssz (which is the discussion above)

author: sproul
content:
On the CL side it's already an SSZ tree hash. Atm there are two types called `ExecutionPayloadHeader`.

See: <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/bellatrix/beacon-chain.md#process_execution_payload>

author: funnygiulio
content: but would that make the ExecutionPayloadHeader invalid for Execution?  EL will reject such Header. is there any reason why?

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> They transform it before passing to the el, thats why we want to change it in el

author: funnygiulio
content: okay that is good to know

author: funnygiulio
content: was that an actual intentional design choice and  is there actually a reason though? just curious

author: funnygiulio
content: its just weird to me that the "Execution"PayloadHeader is not an Execution object

author: sproul
content: I think it was to avoid having RLP in the CL or SSZ in the EL. Now that we're post-merge it seems both CL and EL are more willing to incorporate both.

author: funnygiulio
content: okay, that means that I was indeed not hallucinating lol
